Adult (borealis).description: Red-tailed Hawks are larger than Red-shouldered Hawks, with broader wings and slower wingbeats. Adult Red-tails usually show a reddish top of the tail, and a dark “belly band” unlike the rusty-bellied Red-shouldered.

Juvenile light morph (calurus/alascensis.description: The streaking on juvenile Red-tailed Hawks is often concentrated on the belly and not the chest as it is on juvenile Red-shouldered Hawks.

Adult light morph.description: Adult Broad-winged Hawks are generally paler below than adult Red-shouldered Hawks, with less rust color on the belly and inner wing linings.

Juvenile light morph.description: Broad-winged Hawks are stockier than Red-shouldered and have more pointed wingtips. Broad-winged Hawks also tend to soar with their wings held straight out, whereas Red-shouldered tend to push their wings forward.

Adult.description: Cooper's Hawks have much longer tails, more lanky proportions, and shorter wings than Red-shouldered Hawks.

Juvenile.description: Cooper's Hawks look rather slim and straight backed when perched, unlike the hunchbacked and short-tailed look of Red-shouldered Hawks. Juveniles have thinner streaks on the breast than juvenile Red-shouldered Hawks.

Adult (Northern).description: Adult Sharp-shinned Hawks are gray above (not brown like Red-shouldered Hawks) and lack their red shoulder.

Immature (Northern).description: Sharp-shinned Hawks have longer tails and shorter, narrower wings than Red-shouldered Hawks.
